CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 4, 1950, pg. 1, reads: "The Terrell Collie - He's recovering from attack." Accompanying article reads: "Man Stabs Dog, Court Fines Him, Pet Recovering - A Hill District man got wound up last Sunday and virtually 'blew his top' when he stabbed a 2-year-old Collie dog belonging to his cousin.  Magistrate Robert E. Williams fine the 'villain.' Charles Terrell, 47, 67 Hoffers Way, $20 after he was arrested on a charge of cruelty to animals.  According to police, Terrell could give no reason for his attack on the dog.  He reportedly broke a wine bottle and holding it by the neck, stabbed the dog,  inflicting deep lacerations under the left eye.  The Humane Society called in Animal Rescue League and 'Collie' was taken in for treatment.  Police were called by the owners, Mr. and Mrs. Baldwin B. Terrell of 44 Caramel Way.  The hearing was held at Centre Avenue police station.  As for the 'Collie,' his condition is greatly improved."
TitMainTitle: Dog, "Collie," with stabbing injury above eye, lying on newspapers in kennel at Animal Rescue League
